title: SQL ServerLOG10()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerLOG10()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the base-10 logarithm of 2:
SELECT LOG10(2);

Definition and Usage
The LOG10() function returns the natural logarithm of a number to base 10.
Note:
Also look at the
LOG()
function.
Syntax
LOG10(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A number greater than 0
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return the base-10 logarithm of 4.5:
SELECT LOG10(4.5);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerLOG10()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerLOG10()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerLOG10()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
